properties.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 1:47PM MST until January 28 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
...SNOW CONTINUES IN THE MOUNTAINS...

.Snow continues today as an upper level weather disturbance moves
across the state. Generally light snow accumulations can be
expected in the mountains through tonight, but heavier snow is
occurring in the mountains along and north of Rabbit Ears Pass.

Roads across Rabbit Ears pass are already snow covered and slick
this afternoon, which will continue overnight as temperatures
drop. If you are traveling in the northern mountains of Colorado,
be prepared for slick and hazardous winter travel conditions.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow of 3-5 inches resulting in
total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as
high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass.

* WHEN...From now until midnight MST tonight.

* IMPACTS...Travel may be hazardous due to snow covered roads.
Patchy blowing snow could reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling through the mountains.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT
